Creating narratives that attract talent

The start

I was hired to be part of the Talent Acquisition Team in Dell Mexico. My role was to work in partnership with the Social Media Lead to create campaigns that attracted talent to the company.


Role:

The main task was to build narratives that attracted people to apply to Dell Mexico, the goal was to increase the rate of new hires coming from our social media marketing efforts. I was responsible for the execution of the Q2 and Q3 campaigns. I worked with the University Relations team, the Finance team, and the Cybersecurity team to contribute to their talent search.


Site homepage

Process

I divided my process in three main areas: research, scripting, post production and building, and implementation.


By researching the internal teams, their day-to-day, stories, and expectations I got a solid idea of the mindset for the roles. By getting to know more about the market I was able to identify their needs and expectations.


I scripted a story for every campaign, contextualizing the aforementioned research insights to a narrative that could resonate with the audience.


I created a bank media assets that allowed me to streamline the production process.

The Outcome:

We saw a 20% increase in new hires being referred by social media campaigns.


Through this project I experienced the importance of creating systems to streamline workflow and output. The importance of research and how an increased awareness of the internal and external context puts you in a position where you can identify opportunities more effectively.
